attributes.comment:
Employment based legal immigrants, like me, have been waiting for years to get
out of this mess, paying more dollar year after year.

Remember, EB immigration is married to the job. That means, no promotion, no
substantial increase in salary. Imagine this for over six year or more. Trying to
balance the family budget and paying more and more fees for "immigration
benefits," is a taxing financially and mentally.

With DOL clearing me to work and the Immigration petition to from my employer
approved, why should my wait due to 'quotas' actually translate to more fee.

I have filled my GC application for August 2002 and since there were some
complications within the system, the processing of my application is taking about
5 years. While this delay is not my fault, now I have to pay the consequences of
increased fees. I think people who have filled their applications before April 2,
2007, should pay at rates that existed at the time of the application, that way any
delays in processing will not affect the applicants.

I STRONGLY OPPOSE this fee increase.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Alexander Gerasimov
